user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of digest_auth_check_all:
```c
static enum MHD_DigestAuthResult
digest_auth_check_all (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                       const char *realm,
                       const char *username,
                       const char *password,
                       const uint8_t *userdigest,
                       unsigned int nonce_timeout,
                       uint32_t max_nc,
                       enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiQOP mqop,
                       enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3 malgo3)
{
  enum MHD_DigestAuthResult res;
  char *buf;
  struct DigestAlgorithm da;

  buf = NULL;
  digest_setup_zero (&da);
  if (0 == nonce_timeout)
    nonce_timeout = connection->daemon->dauth_def_nonce_timeout;
  if (0 == max_nc)
    max_nc = connection->daemon->dauth_def_max_nc;
  res = digest_auth_check_all_inner (connection, realm, username, password,
                                     userdigest,
                                     nonce_timeout,
                                     max_nc, mqop, malgo3,
                                     &buf, &da);
  digest_deinit (&da);
  if (NULL != buf)
    free (buf);

  return res;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The two fragments above modify the function parameters nonce_timeout and max_nc and therefore should be investigated under MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8. Other code in the function does not modify any parameter itself: connection, realm, username, password and userdigest (pointer parameters) are only read and not reassigned; buf and da are local variables (buf initialized to NULL and da set up/deinitialized locally) and may be modified or passed by address to inner functions — modifying the object referred to by a pointer parameter is allowed, but no pointer parameter itself is reassigned in this function. The calls to digest_auth_check_all_inner, digest_setup_zero, digest_deinit and free operate on local objects or passed-in pointers without reassigning the function's pointer parameters, so they do not need investigation for this rule.
